articles.description:
Added: support an experimental template for YouTube feed üì∫ Demo | Source

Aggregate content from any YouTube channel rss url https://www.youtube.com/feeds/videos.xml?channel_id=<replace_with_channel_id>
Videos are embedded via iframe and loading accelerated by youtube-lite-embed
Ads are reduced thanks to YouTube's policy for embedded videos üôÉ
Works on mobile devices with butter smooth horizontal scroll.
Caveat: the template works only with YouTube content. You cannot mix textual RSS feed or other video sources such as Vimeo.
Changed: Default HTML template meta tag adjusted to match convention
Changed: sources in template data is now ordered by last update timestamp (as opposed to alphabetical)
Thank you @PiyushLosalka
articles.title: v1.11.0

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Todd Libby)
articles.description: Accessibility is often overlooked or bolted on to the end of a project. Let‚Äôs figure out how to implement and advocate for accessibility from the inception of a project to the release or handoff and beyond.
articles.title: Making A Strong Case For Accessibility

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Uma Victor)
articles.description: Even though Vue.js claims to have an approachable minimalist framework that can be incrementally adaptable, it can be a little bit overwhelming when starting as a Vue.js newbie. In this article, we‚Äôre looking at ways to make writing Vue.js a breeze.
articles.title: Tools And Practices To Speed Up The Vue.js Development Process

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Emiliano Cicero)
articles.description: Interactive Components in Figma allows designers to create a component with states (hover, active, clicked, focus) and make it interactive so that every copy of the component will inherit those same interactions by default. Let‚Äôs explore how it can reduce the time and effort needed to create interactions for your mock-ups.
articles.title: An Introduction To Figma Interactive Components

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Emmanuel Tissera)
articles.description: There is an array of Headless CMSes out there. In this article, we delve into headless CMS features to satisfy your content editors, marketers and yourself as a developer. For the experience headless practitioner, this could be a checklist to see what‚Äôs new out there. For those starting out on their headless journey, this could be a guide on what to look for.
articles.title: How To Choose A Headless CMS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ahmad Shadeed)
articles.description: In this article, Ahmad Shadeed explains what HSL is, how to use it, and shares some of the useful use-cases and examples that you can use right away in your current projects.
articles.title: Using HSL Colors In CSS

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Andriy Zapisotskyi)
articles.description: With so many tools and approaches, email still has quite a few pain points, both for developers and email marketers. Email is difficult because it has too many aspects to set and a few instances with no common rules to follow.
articles.title: Email Testing Flow As It Should Be

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ramona Schwering)
articles.description: When writing front-end tests, you‚Äôll find a lot of pitfalls along the way. Let‚Äôs explore common mistakes developers make, and how to avoid them. Testing doesn‚Äôt need to be painful, after all.
articles.title: It‚Äôs A (Front-End Testing) Trap! Six Common Testing Pitfalls And How To Solve Them

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Surma)
articles.description: The web is single-threaded. This makes it increasingly hard to write smooth and responsive apps. Workers have a bad rep, but can be an important and useful tool in any web developer's toolbelt for these kinds of problems. Let‚Äôs get up to speed on Workers on the Web!
articles.title: The State Of Web Workers In 2021

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs welcome July with some fresh desktop wallpapers. Designed by artists and designers from around the world, they are available with and without a calendar. Enjoy!
articles.title: The Many Shades Of July (2021 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (√Åtila Fassina)
articles.description: Static Generation is great for performance ‚Äî until the app gets too big and build-times go through the roof. Today, we‚Äôll have a look at how Netlify‚Äôs fresh On-Demand Builders can fix that.
articles.title: Breaking Down Bulky Builds With Netlify And Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)

articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 40 With Mike Cavaliere: What Is Chakra UI For React?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Manuel Matuzoviƒá)
articles.description: In this article, Manuel explains why Emmet is one of his favorite productivity tools for writing HTML and CSS, and how you can create custom Emmet snippets in Visual Studio Code to help you improve your front-end workflows even more.
articles.title: Creating Custom Emmet Snippets In VS Code

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Dom Habersack)
articles.description: This article explains how we can connect different types of content in a Next.js application. With this technique, we can add any kind of one-to-one, one-to-many, or even many-to-many relationship to our projects.
articles.title: Creating A Multi-Author Blog With Next.js

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Mark Lankmilier)
articles.description: This article is a case study of how a UX audit affects a UI. It explains how a famous educational platform can be analyzed edX against Jakob Nielsen‚Äôs usability guidelines. To get started, Mark Lankmiller shares all of the criteria and metrics he used for his UX audit.
articles.title: How To Run A UX Audit For A Major EdTech Platform (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Josh Singer)
articles.description: In the dynamic and unpredictable environments in which we work, even the most carefully crafted solutions can have a short shelf life. When we accept that our work is impermanent and our problem-solving abilities are limited, our goal can shift from delivering full solutions to developing tools that empower our users to adaptively design for themselves.
articles.title: The Rise Of Design Thinking As A Problem Solving Strategy

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Iris Lje≈°njanin)
articles.description: Frontend and design are remarkably complex these days. That‚Äôs why we invite kind, smart folks from the community to run [online workshops](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops/) for all of us to learn together. And we have new ones coming up, and we‚Äôd like to kindly welcome you to join in.
articles.title: Smashing Online Workshops (July-October 2021)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cameron Cundiff)
articles.description: Automated testing is an important part of any software project, including testing for accessibility. There are already tools for linting and integration testing accessibility, but what about end-to-end testing with real assistive technology? Since I hadn‚Äôt seen this before, I set out to build Auto VO, a driver for the VoiceOver screen reader.
articles.title: Automating Screen Reader Testing On macOS Using Auto VO

This article focuses on the best practices for improving the design to development processes and how cutting-edge solutions, such as UXPin powered by Merge technology, can help in facilitating the change.
articles.title: Designing With Code: A Modern Approach To Design (Development Challenges)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ayobami Ogundiran)
articles.description: Do you have to process data manually because it is served through images or scanned documents? An image-to-text conversion makes it possible to extract text from images to automate the processing of texts on images, videos, and scanned documents. In this article, we look at how to convert an image to text with React and Tesseract.js(OCR), preprocess images, and deal with the limitations of Tesseract (OCR).

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ottomatias Peura)
articles.description: Voice assistants are currently the most popular use case for voice user interfaces. However, due to the bad feedback loop resulting from voice assistants can only solve simple user tasks such as setting an alarm or playing music. In order for voice user interfaces to really break through, feedback to the user must be visual, not auditive.
articles.title: An Alternative Voice UI To Voice Assistants

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adebiyi Adedotun)

articles.title: How to Automatically Generate C# Code Snippets in Visual Studio

articles.author: Conor Bronsdon
articles.description:
Should you be hiring a software developer or a senior software developer‚Ä¶and what‚Äôs the difference? And how can you know during an interview? 
To help answer these questions, Tomasz Waraksa, a tenured senior software developer with decades of hiring experience, joins the Dev Interrupted podcast to explain how companies should rethink their approach to hiring a senior software developer, and what it means when one joins your team.
Listen to the full episode







  
  
  Episode Highlights include:



The different between a regular and senior developer
What to ask a senior software developer during the hiring process
How this senior role has changed over the decades
What you should expect from a senior developer after hiring one
Join the Dev Interrupted Discord Server


With over 1200 members, the Dev Interrupted Discord Community is the best place for Engineering Leaders to engage in daily conversation. No sales people allowed. Join the community >>
articles.title: Uncover the Real Senior Developer w/ Tomasz Waraksa

articles.author: Aya Bouchiha
articles.description:
hi guys, on this beautiful day we'll talk about Breadth-First Search
Breadth-First Search: is an algorithm that traverses and searches in trees and graphs using recursion and queue data structure, this algorithm comes to avoid processing a node more than once.



Space complexlity
O(V)




Time complexity
O(V+E)



Google maps 
Cheney's algorithm
Search Engines
Peer to Peer Networking
Ford-Fulkerson algorithm
Initialize a queue 


Mark the node as visited by inserting it to a list


Insert the vertices into the queue


While len(queue) > 0:
Delete the first item of the queue 
mark as visited and push all adjacents unvisited nodes of the deleted Item.
more details...
If you are not familiar with python, I recommend you check this series
# CODE FROM https://favtutor.com/blogs/breadth-first-s‚Ä¶
articles.title: Breadth First Search (BFS) Algorithm

articles.author: Matteo Bruni
articles.description:
tsParticles 1.31.0


First of all, thanks to all users that left a stars to this project, it's growing fast for being just a new particles library.

I wanted to release the 1.31.0 version when 2K stars reached since it was a close target.
Now let's see what's new in this version
Added zIndex options, closes #979
Added particles groups to options
Infection is now a plugin, and it's included and is not included in the slim version
Changed particles move distance options to an horizontal/vertical object, single number still valid




Here we can see the new Z Index effect, particles are in different "layers" and opacity is not affected by configuration.
Let's set a new target to 3K stars from now, thanks for the new star ‚≠êÔ∏è
 / 
        tsparticles
      
    

A lightweight TypeScript library for creating particles. Dependency free (*), browser ready and compatible with React, Vue, Angular, Svelte, jQuery, Preact, Inferno
         
This library is available on the two most popular CDNs and it's easy and ready to use, if you were using particles.js it's even easier.
You'll find the instructions below, with all the links you need, and don't be scared by TypeScript, it's just the source language.
The output files are just JavaScript. ü§©
CDNs and npm have all the sources you need in Javascript, a bundle browser ready (tsparticles.min.js) and all files splitted for import syntax.
If you are still interested some lines below there are some instructions for migrating from the old particles.js library.
Library installation


Hosting / CDN

Please use this hosts or your own to‚Ä¶
View on GitHub
You can see other configurations and articles in my profile

articles.author: HIPHOP and CODE
articles.description:
liner notes:
Professional : Not a bad day. Didn't have any meetings so I was able to put some things into their final states where it doesn't rely on me doing anything else and it's in another person's hands. Reviewed some pull requests. Got some pull requests I made merged. Oh and when I went to work on that social media site that has been giving me trouble again said my activity may be against their community guide lines. I have done nothing expect accept an invite from a co-worker and was added to a work test group. That's it! This social media site sucks!!! I had to upload a photo of myself to be reviewed. I still don't have access and they have my photo. Terrible!


Personal : So I got the thumbnail generation stuff worked out. I was also able to get the front end to pull the videos that have thumbnails and show them on the videos archive page. I think I'll have it all ready for the next live streams on Sunday. I want to get the videos in the dashboard so I can edit, deleted, get thumbnails generated for old videos etc. That will probably come after my next thing which is to get the details and transcripts of the archived videos automatically created with an API I've recently come across.




Going to focus on finishing putting together the radio show for tomorrow and then work on some stuff for the live stream on Sunday. The new "Black Widow" movie came out so I may watch that or maybe work on my side project. That's about it.
Have a great night and weekend!
peace piece
https://dwane.io / https://HIPHOPandCODE.com
articles.title: Day 405 : Generation

articles.author: Suprabha
articles.description:
You will learn the basics of JavaScript by creating the following ten games:
CheckiO



Teachers all over the world use CheckiO as an extra-tool during their courses so that students could practice their skills when learning new material.
JSRobot



Learn JavaScript by playing a platform game
JSDares



You learn programming by completing dares. These are short puzzles in which you have to copy the example, in as few lines of code as possible.
Coding Game



CodinGame is a challenge-based training platform for programmers where you can improve your coding skills with fun exercises (25+ languages supported)
Robocode



Robocode is a programming game, where the goal is to develop a robot battle tank to battle against other tanks in Java or .NET. The robot battles are running in real-time and on-screen.
Code Combat



CodeCombat is an HTML5 role-playing game (RPG) that teaches you fundamental programming concepts. CodeCombat supports 5 programming languages.
Screeps



Screeps is a fun game and has a unique angle to it.
Untrusted



The game presents you with a roguelike-like playing environment and a console window with the JavaScript code generating each level.
Crunchzilla



Crunchzilla offers interactive tutorials that get people excited about programming. Play with code, build, and learn.
Elevator Saga



This is a game of programming!
Thanks for reading!
Hope you enjoyed reading the article üòâ 


  
    
 Twitter
      
      
        üë©üèª‚Äçüíª  suprabha.me
      

        üåü  Instagram
articles.title: Learn JavaScript Coding by Playing Games üéÆ

articles.author: Maxine Meurer
articles.description:
Table Of Contents



Introduction
Installation
Create Redux Store
Create Slicers
Add Reducers to Store
Performing Asynchronous Logic and Data Fetching
Conclusion
Over the last couple days I realized I wasn't alone in learning the wonders of redux toolkit. So for those of you that are in the same boat as me, get ready for some ducks!



Redux Toolkit is package that was built on top of Redux an open-source JS library for managing application state. The package allows the user to avoid unnecessary boilerplate code, and supplies APIs that make applications DRYer and more maintainable. If you'd like to read more about Redux Toolkit and its features, I have another blog post available here. 
Today we'll be focusing on how to implement Redux toolkit in a React-Redux application. 



First and fo‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to add Redux Toolkit to a React-Redux application

articles.author: Jos√© Trindade
articles.description:
Multiple column layouts on large screens that collapse to drawers or popup's on small screens are extremely common on responsive apps. In this tutorial I will show you how to create exactly that.
The full code can be found on github.
responsive flutter layout item list demo
Before we start coding let's define exactly what we want to achieve and tackle each part in incremental steps. This will help us focus on the task and keep track of our progress as we go along.
In a nutshell, we want a widget that updates how the children are displayed depending on the screen size of the Window. It should split into two panes when on large screens; on small screens it should show only one pane and open a popup for the second pane as needed:
Flexible layout
Two panes for big screens and one for small scr‚Ä¶
articles.title: Responsive two columns layout in flutter

articles.author: Ankit Kumar
articles.description:
Database design is structuring data and organised relationships in a database. It goes beyond how the database further works.
dbdigram.io for designing a database so hitting a random try for Bank Database design. 
Requirements
Create and manage accounts { owner, branch, balance details...}
Record all transactions history from accounts -> to accounts etc.
Perform money transfer between 2 accounts consistently within a transactions
Maintaining a Loan Records
Database Design
The basics of database design are identifying what data needs to get stored, grouping such data into tables or collections and adding relationships between related data points. The whole database design process involves
Using Entity-Relationship(ER) diagrams to visualize the objects that get stored and their relationships‚Ä¶
articles.title: Data Modelling / Database Design

articles.author: Gracie Gregory (she/her)

Looking back on your week, what was something you're proud of?
All wins count ‚Äî big or small üéâ

Congrats on your wins this week!

articles.author: Brandon Weaver
articles.description:
Perhaps my personal favorite recommendation for learning to program Ruby like a Rubyist, Eloquent Ruby is a book I recommend frequently to this day. That said, it was released in 2011 and things have changed a bit since then.
This series will focus on reading over Eloquent Ruby, noting things that may have changed or been updated since 2011 (around Ruby 1.9.2) to today (2021 ‚Äî Ruby 3.0.x).
Without further ado, let‚Äôs get started!
Note: This is an updated version of a previous unfinished Medium series of mine you can find here.
We start in with an introduction on writing code that looks and feels like Ruby.
The first example in practice is the following class:
class Document
  attr_accessor :title, :author, :content

  def initialize(title, author, content)
    @title = title
    @author = a‚Ä¶
articles.title: Let's Read ‚Äì Eloquent Ruby ‚Äì Ch 1

articles.author: Francesco Di Donato
articles.description:
The Compound Pattern allows you to associate one or more sub-components to a component. These can be repeated and reallocated. Above all, they allow you to encapulate the structure, style and logic relating to a portion of the UI.
The High Order Component is the extension in the React context of the High Order Function. Basically it is a function that wraps a component and enhances it and/or injects additional functionality.
Have you ever tried to use the second over the first? If so, you will have realized that React will complain. I'll tell you more - he's right.
Create Compound Component (more)
Create High Order Component (more)
Merging... it fails!
Reasoning to the solution
Abstract away the problem
If you are already aware of both patterns skip to step 3
Repo with full code
To better ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Merge High Order Component and Compound Pattern

articles.author: Daniel Lemire
articles.description: JSON is the de facto standard for exchanging data on the Internet. It is relatively simple text format inspired by JavaScript. I say ‚Äúrelatively simple‚Äù because you can read and understand the entire JSON specification in minutes. Though JSON is a concise format, it is also better used over a slow network in compressed mode. ‚Ä¶ Continue reading Compressing JSON: gzip vs zstd
articles.title: Compressing JSON: gzip vs zstd

articles.description: Reportedly, half of us own a smartphone. It is often reported that women or visible minority earn less money. However, ugly people are doing comparatively even more poorly. Handling an increasing ‚Ä¶ Continue reading Science and Technology links (June 26th 2021)
